website_summaries.verdict: Only those who do a lot of local intensive tasks via Wi-Fi, or who can appreciate the Asus RT-AC3200's excellent feature set, will find this router worth the investment.
pros: The Asus RT-AC3200 Tri-Band Wireless Gigabit Route has powerful hardware and good performance
The router has many helpful features, including the ability to keep malware from entering your home network, and it can also work as a powerful VPN/NAS server
cons: It has a bulky, somewhat impractical design and you can't name clients on the IP reservation list anything other than their MAC address

customer_reviews.title: Feature Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on reviews and features. I was very happy with the operation of this device until about a month ago. In a recent firmware update. ASUS and their partner TrendMicro decided to require that you provide them with personal information in order to use specific features(AIProtection: Network Protection - Web/App parental controls, Adapative QoS and Traffic Analysis). If you opt out of providing them with personal information the features are automatically disabled. This is a very shady business practice bordering on bait and switch. I've tried reaching out to them via support channels. The response was to provide me a link to TrendMicro's policy and say tell me "sorry it's policy. there's nothing we can do."
customer_reviews.author: James Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: We loved this from day one (after we figured out how to get it to work). I’ve been working with computers and networking devices for about 20 years. I know my way around any type of gadget. This was difficult but not impossible to set up. We were really happy with the speed and connectivity until now. After three months, all of our smaller devices drop the internet constantly. Laptops and TVs seem to stay connected. Nothing mobile will hold a signal. Hoping it’s not too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Schisler

customer_reviews.title: Great router so far
customer_reviews.text: I was having router issues. Could not reach my whole house without extender routers. Bought this router based on reviews stating how powerful it is. Had problems at first, but found out my extenders were conflicting with this routers signal, (DHCP ip address conflicts). Disconnected extender routers, and found the signal from this router was so good, I no longer needed them. Just remember, this router is NOT Aimesh compatible, according to what I read. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Time for a class action, any attornies out there?
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same problem as many, 2.4 GHz died and I spent hours and hours and hours trying to get a myriad of smart home devices in my house working again. Terrible. Someone should have to pay. Did I mention I spent HOURS trying to find the problem? We should all try to return them to Amazon out of warranty until they stop selling this POS's - And certainly not give it the Amazon Recommended label. Holy Crap. Anyone interested in this device should run away, pants on fire. This sucker will take you down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael St Denis

customer_reviews.title: beware of Asus
customer_reviews.text: My Asus router worked good for about 4 months until the wireless portion failed. I called Asus support for help and it was a complete waste of time. Asus has the worst customer support that I have ever dealt with. I cut my loses and bought a Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: kwd57

customer_reviews.title: Firmware glitch... If you enable QOS/Guest bandwidth limit, PERM.capped at ~340/320Mbps (w/500/500)
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, but I have a 500/500 Mbps FiOS link... ... ... Firmware: Current: 3.0.0.4.382_51939 If you enable QOS bandwidth limiting, OR Guest bandwidth limit you can only get ~340/~320Mbps, even on the wired pipe, even if you go back and change the settings back!!! If you change the setting back, you STILL get glitched capped-bandwidth at these speeds... This is a firmware glitch, and I don't know why I am the only one finding these Asus Router glitches, maybe I should work for them...(make offer :) )? You have to go back to a prior config, or factory the unit to get back to 500/500 Mbps...
customer_reviews.author: LinuxAssailant

customer_reviews.title: Very nice router
customer_reviews.text: This router has a very user-friendly setup interface. Each of the three WiFi bands can be set up with its own password. This makes granting access to guests simpler by dedicating one of the bands to guests.
customer_reviews.author: Hiland Watts

customer_reviews.title: 4 Year old tech...Random Reboots
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ASUS router. Because the router is 4 years old (which I can't believe AMAZON is still selling it) I will not beat up ASUS. Might have been good when it came out...IDK. Setup was a breeze and I absolutely love the web and android apps! HOWEVER, unit started randomly rebooting.....when I thought I had it is fixed (forum reading) it would go out again. Actually almost cost me my second job. So NO I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS ITEM. It's freak'n over 4 years old!! Returned and went back to Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: SJGUSMC21

customer_reviews.title: Set up required before use, awesome router
customer_reviews.text: YOU HAVE TO CONNECT THIS TO A DESKTOP/LAPTOP BEFORE IT'LL WORK!! Just follow the instructions and it's super easy. The range is huge, but more importantly the built in UI is easy to use and not from 1992, lol. They force you to set up a wireless is and password, which tbh is a good thing. They also made this process fairly easy with its updated user interface and instructions. I'm no IT person, but I was able to click through the screens. If you want a high performance router, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: A beast of a router.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this router after my old one stopped reaching my driveway, despite trouble shooting orientation and band settings. This thing is a world of difference. It reaches down the block, and hasn't given me any issues in over a month. The interface is packed with features, and is easier to navigate than most of the ones I've seen. It's still not super easy to navigate/use, but it's not awful. I'm a fairly advanced technology user, but I think the quick setup is easy and sufficient for less advanced users. I'd definitely buy this again, and recommend it to anyone needing a great router.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months, then it started to fail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was going to be a nice good router, better than my old ASUS RT-N66U but it wasn't. I think it is even worse. After 2 months from buying it, it started to fail, disconnecting and not being able to connect devices. Tried updating the firmware but the problem continued. Also the second 5GHz signal started to fail and dropped the signal strength significantly. I still have it and use it, but it constantly present problems. The user interface of the admin page is nice though. About a year ago, I bought a Linksys EA6350 to extend my WiFi coverage and is being working great. My next router will be a Linksys definitely.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of power, range, very easy install!
customer_reviews.text: My first ASUS router was an RT-AC66U dual band gigabit device and I loved it. I used it for almost 3 years. Having aquired 4K TV, HD TV, etc., I needed additional power, range, and the RT-AC3200 Tri-Band with it Smart Connect, AI protection, extraordinarily ease of installing, etc., delivers. My one complaint is in some of the lack of documentation in load balancing, a 137 page User Guide that you have to print. I strongly reccomend for newbi or Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Glockman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Parental Controls
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for the time control in parental control. It only does up to 16 devices but we only have about 5 to limit to time. I would recommend, seems like the only brand that does this with this much detail. I also like that you can see traffic and usages per device attached.
customer_reviews.author: Deenard

customer_reviews.title: Ok -not great- overage in a 3 story th, for 6 months - then...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Sept 2019. This past Friday it went 'out' in mid-use, such that a wired connection to a desktop was fine but the wifi was gone, undetectable on every device, and a tech-support call with ex-spouse yielded no fruit. i should probably look for a refund, but honestly at this point the bar is so gd low in term of tech longevity : / replaced with another brand at slightly below this pricepoint this morning: i get an extra "bar" here on the top floor and i can see increased responsiveness in browser as well as crisper graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great router after upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Awsome router. Warning the upgrade deactivated the Wireless. So you will have to turn on the three wireless bands. Youwouls have thought that someone could take a moment to mention that. Still I had to troubleshoot this for two minutes on my Linux computer to discover I had none of my ASUS router bands on. I was falsly lulled into the functionality when I itlnitally set up the Router. Then I did it to myself when it asked me if I wanted to upgrade my router. It turns out I had to start configuring it all over from the beginning. Plus turn on the wireless network interfaces.
customer_reviews.author: George Van Tuyl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance on both bands
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance on both bands. Firmware is very robust and gives excellent QoS options, including per_MAC throughput limits, and very detailed per_user bandwidth usage, apps which utilize bandwidth the most, ...etc. Only limitation is it does not allow per_IP (nor per_MAC) web filtering. Tried to install Tomato by Shibby (or Tomato Advanced) open source firmware, and it simply would not take it, so had to return it and fall back on TP-Link loaded with Gargoyle open source firmware. If you are a power user who likes to control traffic for all connected devices, this router is an excellent option. Do not forget to pair with OpenDNS for strong porn (and tens of other categories) filtering for your household...
customer_reviews.author: M_shaltot

customer_reviews.title: Failing after only 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This will be my last Asus product. There was a time were Asus stood for quality, but no more. This router routinely refuses to allow me access to the login page across multiple devices. I've tried on the Asus Android app on my phone, multiple browsers on my phone, and multiple browsers on my computer. All return nothing or return a page stating that "Settings have changed" and you can NEVER get to the admin login page. This router is nothing more than a big steaming pile of fail. Do yourself a favor, don't waste your money, and avoid Asus entirely. I would give it zero stars if that were an option.
customer_reviews.author: Orval W. Stuckemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind spending $200 every 18 months this is a great router. I purchased this router 18 months ago and it has been a great router. I was very happy with all aspects of the router. Now, 18 months later the radios that provide the WiFi service keep dropping. Now nothing connected to the WiFi is dependable for internet or intranet service.
customer_reviews.author: Tooliak

customer_reviews.title: Great machine until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2017, and here it is August 2020, and it is dying. Wifi signal continually resets, and the router capability is clearly dying as well. I've decided to split up my network machines to favor dedicated systems. I now have a dedicated TP-LINK router and dedicated TP-LINK AP. Both of them cost me no more than $70. Now if one of them dies I'm not completely dead and locked into an all-in-one machine.
customer_reviews.author: CodedThought

customer_reviews.title: Decent router
customer_reviews.text: I mainly purchased this router due to the logging features which are great. But the router just randomly decides to block devices from connecting. I have cameras and it would block them from connecting to the servers and not allow access remotely. I would not recommend if you use any smart home features because it is not a stable router I have to reboot it daily to keep things working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Sigler

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers you can purchase... period! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a powerful and stable router that gives you multiple firmware build choices, look no further. I'm listing them below in order of personal recommendation. 1. Asuswrt-Merlin "Hardware Accelerated NAT" 2. Shibby's Tomato 3. Toastman's Tomato 4. ASUS Stock "Hardware Accelerated NAT" 5. DD-WRT I've been running custom firmware on several different router models for over a decade. Tomato is my overall favorite for several other router models but I prefer the Asuswrt-Merlin build for the RT-AC3200 and the Xwrt-Vortex build for my Netgear Nighthawk R7000. Install the custom firmware builds at your own risk if you're an inexperienced user.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Sean E

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse router for heavy users.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router on Black Friday two years ago. I am a heavy streamer and my boys are both heavy Fortnite players and YouTube watchers. Daily my router streams Directv Now, Fortnite, Facebook and YouTube simultaneously with nary a hitch. I have had Linksys, Belkin and Netgear routers, and none have come close to the performance of this router. The software isn’t the best out there, but the range is great and it has not given me any type of issues with losing signal. The only thing I have worried about is long play sessions with both of the boys on Fortnite. The router gets really hot. Overall, I am very pleased with this router. Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away. 2.4ghz broken.
customer_reviews.text: *** this router has a limitation of 25 devices on the 2.4 GHz band. This has been confirmed by their tech support as a chip set limitation. I would suggest staying away!!! 2.4 GHz broken. Stay away. After approx 25 2.4 GHz devices have connected it will not allow or reject any new connections unless one is removed. 5ghz appears to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router for any household.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older router for years. it developed problems, so I dove deep to try to discover what the best wireless router on the market was for people who needed a lot of bandwidth and can take advantage of an advanced interface. Everywhere I looked this unit was getting high marks on all categories, range, speed, usability, configurability, security, features. So I picked it up, and just over a month in, I'm not disappointed. While the interface allows some fairly advanced configuration, it also makes basic setups very easy. I made sure to update to the latest firmware before I even bothered to set it up, and haven't had any problems. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cotharyus

customer_reviews.title: Very much recommended for Tomato
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a VPN build because this router is currently the most powerful that is compatible with Tomato Shibby firmware. First, this is a big, nice looking and well build unit. I didn't use the stock firmware, as there are some issues without an update so I flashed the latest Tomato build. Compared to my old RT-N66U the RT-AC3200 is much more powerful. The AC-3200's OpenVPN speeds are 400% that of the N66U.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: TRI-Band is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a crowded household, where wireless users are scattered throughout the home. It's a good thing that I can distribute the users by the band they most need. For example, the television signal is dedicated to one band, gaming on another and PC, laptop and cellphone use on still another. Being able to redistribute by whether the devices are 2.4 GHz, or 5GHz makes it easy for everyone to have uninterrupted service for their own devices. Of course, it does help that we also have 200 MB/S download speed from our ISP!
customer_reviews.author: lawhol56

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this router, not dependable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router November of 2017. It's been back to Asus twice for repair First problem developed at 8 months wouldn't get IP from the cable modem. Asus fixed the issue. Next problem the 2.4 frequency died while the 5.0 frequency worked fine. Asus fixed the problem Now the 2.4 band will not let any device connect even after a reboot. Not going to fix it, time for a new router that is dependable. Turns out these are known issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dalsn1

customer_reviews.title: Huge range. I can get 200+ mbps of my ~300 mbps internet using this router.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps cool. Super customization with settings. Great UI and robust phone app. My only problem is that the antennas are kind of "flimsy" as in when you put them at a 45 degree angle to get maximum coverage, a small bump can cause it to fall over. Not a huge deal, but a silly oversight that wasn't correctable by adjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Al-Hassani

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as promised
customer_reviews.text: This thing promised to have very strong signal and it has a lot of great features. Unfortunately I find that the WiFi itself just doesn't seem as reliable as my old router. Signal seems to cut out occasionally, or when the signal is there somehow the internet access is not always there (or becomes very, very slow). No indication why. My old wifi router is also there in parallel (both are connected to the same modem), and when I switch over to it the internet seems fine. In theory this product should be great, but in reality I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for 2 years and died. R.I.P.
customer_reviews.text: It worked good, not great for 2 years. When I say worked good, I mean the WIFI was a little weak for a 1000 sq./ft. apartment. Then one morning it worked for a bit, then abruptly died. ASUS is supposed to be good equipment. Luckily I have Squaretrade insurance on it. we will see what happens there. They want to fix it, good luck there. Only the LERD lights come on and even the reset button don't work. WOW!
customer_reviews.author: rbhawks22

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as great as I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: It's only been installed a day, but this Asus Router (AC-3200) is the best tough (it's expensive) buying decision I've made his year. First, it's SUPER FAST! Second, and almost as important for me, Asus support Staff was easy to reach, professional, courteous, and patient. I say "they" because I had to call twice, once to install it "wirelessly" and again to upgrade firmware. Great job, Asus!
customer_reviews.author: baileysbca

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this router. I was a little confused by the tri-band setup at first because it uses the same SSID for both 2.4 and 5.8. It would be nice if either the 2.4 could have a different SSID or to have an option to just bond the 5.8 radios. And I am especially happy about having a router once again that has a VPN server! My Linksys router that I struggled with for a year did not offer a VPN server and cost a lot more. I'm sticking with ASUS from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Latest update disallows custom firmware!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as an additional access point (AP mode), and the coverage is phenomenal. The latest update does not allow flashing alternate firmware, so beware those that want DD-WRT, Asus Marlin, or Tomato. I had hoped to install custom firmware and use this as my router, but the lack of custom updates leaves me with a sour taste in my mouth. I'll be replacing my current router with one advertised to support open source firmware. That said, this router works wonderfully, and has great coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls no longer functional
customer_reviews.text: This version fails in the Parental Controls. The web history is not in chronological order, making it near impossible to use. Blocking late night access was possible (this router, and previous one) but only by the hour. It allows you to set and save hours for particular MAC addresses, but then they are immediately lost. Going back in to review them and nothing is retained. I also could not get a new Sono wireless speaker to connect, until setting the bands to Auto, allowing the router to manage who got 2.4 vs. 5.0GHz. Very frustrating as I'm technology literate and have used an earlier model with similar firmware.
customer_reviews.author: BigDog

customer_reviews.title: Over 2 years of use and works flawlessly for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for over 2 years and have not had any problems. I first purchased the Netgear Nighthawk router which worked good for 2 weeks then suddenly lost complete power. The internal software works great and I get consistent firmware upgrades when needed. The Wi-Fi reception is fantastic compared to other routers that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Powerful router, SOHO grade. A lot of features on this router that I haven't seen other manufacturers provide. Upon replacing my old stock router that my ISP provided, speeds increased dramatically. Signal covers my entire house, and you can tweak signal strength (TX) if you find the signal weak - something I've only seen on enterprise AP's. I've owned this router for a few months and haven't encountered any issues. Only once did I run into issues getting into the administrative login to the router - a simple reboot cleared that up. Overall a good router with a lot of features I've yet to dig into.
customer_reviews.author: Don't drink and Prime

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for a few years now, and my next router is definitely going to be an Asus. The web admin interface is amazing, analytics and controls fantastic, and performance is outstanding. We use it for Internet of Things devices, video streaming, VoIP calls, web meetings, large file uploads/downloads, web surfing, everything, and it holds up. The automatic restart schedule is another must-have that this one has!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Imerman

customer_reviews.title: no 2.4 drop outs for me
customer_reviews.text: just got this for my house and it works amazing!! i have over 10+ devices connected at all times especially with 2 teenage girls and my 2.4 never drops off. i like it!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router
customer_reviews.text: Others have gone into detailed specs, so I'll keep this simple. I am a technical professional but not a network engineer. I have a home automation network and a dozen+ IP security cameras in addition to the usual heavy media streaming needs of a typical home. Installation was a breeze and took minutes. The interface is awesome and so well-designed that I think my parents could install this without help. Connections are blazing fast and I haven't had any drops. Setup for more advanced features like port forwarding is simple and intuitive. With so many reviewers complaining of dropped connections, I was nervous, but I've had no issues whatsoever. I'm really pleased with this router.
customer_reviews.author: JungleLuxe

customer_reviews.title: this saved my internet!
customer_reviews.text: Quit being cheep... if you have slow internet- it is likely your router. I wouldn't have believe it but i went from getting 2-3 MBPS on wifi to 45 MBPS immediately (same speed as wired) and the only thing that changed with my wireless router. Yes my router was old. Don't be cheep get this router.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - returning
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Returning the unit after a couple of weeks. Half of the devices in my home would either not connect or would disconnect every time they were turned off - particularly smart tvs - even when signal strength was good. Smart band feature made things even worse as far as connections. When things did connect the speeds were fine. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Krweiss

customer_reviews.title: Very dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: We had an old Linksys 4200 that handled our network way better than this router does. We used to run 3 ps4's, 2 laptops, 3 smart phones and 1 fire TV stick and would only experience intermittent lag periodically. I bought this one hoping to eliminate that lag but now I can't even game while the fire TV stick is online! And my PS4 is hardwired. Not sure what to do but it sure does look like this router is the culprit. We've kept it up to date but still as bad as ever and seems like a waist of money. UPDATE: We replaced this router with a different brand and no longer experience the lag issues, incredible difference.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: The range is slightly better. However
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy--four stars for the experience of setting it up. Performance, though, is just okay. It has been reliable, but I haven't noticed any appreciable speed increase from my prior, very old router (Actiontec FIOS router). I was hoping for a noticeable improvement. The range is slightly better. However, for a high-end, top-of-the-line router, my expectations were higher. I am not a "techie", so I have tweaked the router very much. I do use the SmartConnect and other features on the router. Works as advertised. No problem with dropped connections at all so far.
customer_reviews.author: JAP VI

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 2yrs now... no issues with everything i throw at it! Over 35 home devices connected at one time.. still no wireless dropouts!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fails when it gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: Have had the ASUS AC3200 Tri-Band since January. Works for about an hour and then quits. Everything. No wifi no wired connection pass through.... So disappointing. . Had such good exp with an Asus 66 I was really expecting the same experience. It's been mostly a battle these last 3 months. Done with Asus. John
customer_reviews.author: Erin E Govednik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent workhorse of a WiFi router and highly configurable
customer_reviews.text: From time to time I need to look at the manual to figure something out, but for the most part the control panel is fairly intuitive. This unit has tons of useful features.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Falk

customer_reviews.title: The range is AMAZING and we are finally getting the speeds we've been ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this router has done everything we could have wanted. The range is AMAZING and we are finally getting the speeds we've been paying for but our old router just could not handle on multiple devices. The only problem we've run into is one of the 5G bands suddenly no longer accepts the password only on select devices that is clearly set as the password. Still trying to figure that one out.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Lacking AiMesh
customer_reviews.text: OK router, not extraordinary. Too big and cumbersome with awkward antenna positions. I preferred the RT-AC68U form factor better better. Main reason for return, does not support AiMesh even though it's a newer model than the RT-AC68U. Waiting for the RT-AX86U.
customer_reviews.author: OSokona

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Netgear products I bought this Asus router to replace a Netgear router that I had been waiting for over a year for a firmware update. This router has good range and does not slow down like my old one. I like it very much and would buy another. I have had no need for their tech support as everything has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Overheats frequently
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this router, but we've been battling intermittent failures for the past two years with it. We believe it is regularly overheating, causing failure and the internet to drop out. This has caused massive problems in my business, such as losing the cash registers, losing streaming music for customers, not to mention losing the internet for all employees. This will be the last ASUS router I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cavendish

customer_reviews.title: Great for lots of devices on WIFi
customer_reviews.text: This is one powerful wifi router. My old ASUS one lasted many years and finally statred to have issues. Decided to go with the same brand again. We work from home full time and between work and kids at any gived time have 15 plus devices on WIFI at any given time. This router handles it all well and we have not had one issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: AJones Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal on two bands. Unusable third band. Poor SmartConnect implementation.
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced my RT-AC68U with this. The good news is that the signal is definitely stronger through the house. The bad news is that the first 5GHz band has such a weak signal it is unusable (a 2015 iMac in direct line of site about 30 feet away could often not even see the SSID, let alone sustain a connection). I've also read that the SmartConnect feature on these is unusable unless you are a serious expert with hours to spare (see the recent WireCutter review). Not sure if its a keeper yet; I'll update this review after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: G. A Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not the best choice
customer_reviews.text: Set up was difficult, Wi-Fi sometimes takes forever to connect and multiple password login attempts. If you're hard wired to the router it's great. Range for Wi-Fi is good. Personally, I prefer the Netgear Nighthawk AC2300. It's simple to set up and connect to. Price is pretty much the same. After a month of using this router. It STINKS!!! Connect, disconnect, connect, disconnect. On and on it goes. Has a COMPLETE mind of it's own.
customer_reviews.author: theanalyzer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Router
customer_reviews.text: A powerhouse of a router. Easy to setup (typical router methods). Setup software is straightforward (clear) except with "enable smart connect" and with that the "Wireless - Smart Connect Rule". I really don't understand the methodology. But I am not using smart connect right now for my network. A nice feature is the one or separate passwords for the 3 available bands. Otherwise this is router certainly one of the better choices to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Immediately install the Asuswrt-merlin firmware
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time with this unit if you aren’t comfortable running the open source Asuswrt-Merlin firmware. Otherwise you will have terrible unreliable 2.4GHZ WiFi. When it works it’s blazing fast. Then the problems start. Your devices drop off WiFi and won’t reconnect. You have to reboot the router. Asus tech support is TERRIBLE and can’t even begin to diagnose the problem or troubleshoot anything with you. They call you every day and ask you to repeat the same steps. Their support email box is always full so you can never get them the files they ask for. I upgraded to the Asuswrt-Merlin code and magically everything is working perfectly now!!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: IT DID NOT WORK FOR MORE THAN 30 SECONDS.
customer_reviews.text: IT DID NOT WORK FOR MORE THAN THIRTY SECONDS THEN GONE. I was unable to return it due to having to be out of the country. Return policy is TOO SHORT for real people. I made a Mistake buying this and pissed away $173.00 Cheers. PS I am not happy
customer_reviews.author: MIKE LISK

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because I needed to cover both floors ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed to cover both floors of a two story office building. The previous router had signal issues if you weren't on the same floor as the router, but this one seems to be able to penetrate through the floors and to the opposite end of the building without any issues. Speed wise it seems to have no issues at all handling a mixture of around 40 wired and wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from ASUS products
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY! Asus support is of no help. First suggestion to fix my issue of constant disconnect from wifi was to do a factory reset of the router. I ended up doing it anyways after many attempt to fix the wacky wifi connection disconnection on all 3 bands. After no one at asus support seems to care to resolve, I ended up putting my old wifi router back and voila, no wifi disconnection issue. Will never buy their products again, refurb or new.
customer_reviews.author: Yer

customer_reviews.title: drop my internet connection 3 to 5 times a day ...
customer_reviews.text: drop my internet connection 3 to 5 times a day have to reboot router every time called support and no help with issue only 6 month in with a brand new system and no one in the support center can help still under warranty but can't return and get my money back they want to repair it which is not possible. Read other peoples reviews the all have the same problem internet drop and tech support are guessing to fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: J.Rivera

customer_reviews.title: This is the best router I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have ever seen. I thought I had to DDWRT it to have full features. But out of box, it has so many features that I don't need custom firmware. You can set your own firewall rules, allowing or deying inbound ips. And you can set parent control based on time. This time scheduling control is 'AWESOME!!!'. It is much much much better than Netgear one. It give you super clear instructions. And on top of that, it can even scan your attached hard drive for errors. And NAT was wonderful. A+++, definitialy money worth!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debby S

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for linksys dual band router
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use as one SSID and some units (most notably %@%^$ iPads) had problems going from band to band. Reconfigured to 3 separate SSIDs and so far this seems better. Had some difficulty getting VPN set up, but found some links that helped. Documentation is a bit weak in this and other areas. Have not explored all the features yet. Signal strength seems a bit better than my 4 year old dual band Linksys. I may do some rewiring and try to move it from a 3 foot high position to a 6 foot position to see if that helps. Wished the single SSID feature worked better, maybe after some firmware updates or ipad updates it will?
customer_reviews.author: Movie Nut

customer_reviews.title: Reaches every corner of my house from the basement to the top floor, even outside!
customer_reviews.text: I have my router in the basement with an ethernet switch which is wired to the entire house. The router signal is solid throughout the basement and main floor with speeds between 60-150 mbps (I'm using Comcast Business with 150mbps). Upstairs and outside I'm able to get a solid signal with speeds between 20-40 mbps. Update: the internet still works fine but the LED lights on the front have stopped working. If I do a power cycle they work for awhile then quit working again. Not sure what the deal is but waiting on ASUS for support.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: ASUS AC3200 for the win! Holy cow! I ...
customer_reviews.text: ASUS AC3200 for the win! Holy cow! I burnt up the wife's Apple Airport Extreme, and my TP-Link N750. I have Wi-Fi cameras, multiple tablets, phones, 3-4 laptops and two PC's. Once I burnt up both routers, it was time for a change, so I started in on some research. Thanks to another Amazon users review, I purchased this, and am extremely grateful! Even with all the network traffic, on the latest firmware update, everything works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: I have had this router for almost 3 months now ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for almost 3 months now. The uplink port goes down at least 5 times a day, and has been doing so since the first week I got it. It frequently needs to be rebooted (at least 1x per week) for the port to come back up again. It's clear from the logs that the port is defective. I finally got sick enough of it that I purchased a new router today to replace this. As a home office worker, this has been incredibly frustrating, and I really just want to throw it out the window, pour gasoline on it, and light it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Best Router ive had
customer_reviews.text: Best router ive had period. I was looking for the impossible. I have an apartment complex and share my internet connection with all my tenants. I wanted to see realtime who was connected, how much they where downloading and uploading, and could limit dowloads by ip, mac, or any other way anyone who was not obeying the rules. This does that, and much much more. Most routers dont show devices connected true other access points or devices with static ips set, like ip cameras. This one shows me everything. If it is connected, i can see it. if it is dowloading, i can see the speed and what he is downloading and limit or cut the access of it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Machado

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: Our home is a bit over 3000 square feet. Doesn't provide great signal everywhere but it better than before.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Black

customer_reviews.title: Must have for 4k streaming
customer_reviews.text: Below was how things went for 3 months. Now I have a paperweight. It will not stay connected to internet for more then 10 seconds. Then it reconnects and then disconnects over and over. I have solid internet, changed cat cable and factory reset. Wow, $200 and sometimes I find food in my fridge that lasts longer then this router - smmh Wow, what a difference from a N900 router. Used older router as access point. Probably not needed since this is great but why not use instead of putting in trash
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Router no longer carries internet from modem
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in july of 2018, set it up, and it worked great. Last week it stopped allowing internet from the modem, didn't work through direct wired connection either. The modem is fine and works when router is bypassed. I have done a hard reset, and checked latest firmware. I'm disappointed in the lifespan of this router, and hopeful of a fix from asus customer support here
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Y.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. Set up was easy. If you are familiar with Asus routers you will know how to customize parameters quickly. You may want to update the firmware during the installation. I checked the firmware version later and it was updated automatically. The router warned me about some malicious sites when I tried to access them. Significantly faster than my old Asus AC66U (power button broke). The signal is powerful in every part of the house indoor and outdoor. I can get a clearbsignal a few houses down the block. So far I am satisfied with the router.
customer_reviews.author: JMartin

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  TV Streaming must.
customer_reviews.text: Life changing WIFI router. We made the change from the router provided by Comcast. This one needed me to hook my laptop directly to the device to setup program. It was pretty self explanatory. Be patient and work it through. I setup three WIFI channels with different passwords. It seems very secure and very fast. This is a professional setup. Im impressed! We STREAM TV 100%. So this was a must for all of our devices.
customer_reviews.author: ATLKrissy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great router. Switches bands fast and automatically
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Switches bands fast and automatically. Very fast. Plenty of guest networks. This router is very customizable and very easy to set up. I have been using this for 5 months with no restarts required so far. I even had two power failures and no problems. Great range also, way better than my previous "L" brand that was supposed to cover more distance than this one. I have Xfinity, 150mbps package and consistently speed test 176-186mbps wireless, 185-200mbps wired. With the Xfinity modem/router rental, I was lucky to get 140mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Skybluealien

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great Router ! First Google Aswert Merlin then download and flash his custom firmware for your model Asus router. Very easy to do. Just go into the router setup and find update firmware and browse to your downloaded Merlin firmware. Reboot router and turn on several good features then rock solid, very fast, high power router.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wonka

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat this
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the asus 66u router and was able to thoroughly test the signal strength before and after the switch. Where before I got 82% 2.4ghz, i got 90%... similar with 5ghz. That isn't an amazing increase but it certainly is nice. I work IT, and the reason I like Asus routers is the interface is clean, easy, and effective. I immediately upgraded to Merlin's newest firmware and have experience zero instability issues for over a week now. The best part is I know it will only get better as Merlin continues to improve the firmware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Pete

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: I've totally lost track of how many routers that I've had over the years. Having been extremely satisfied with my ASUS laptop and motherboard (Republic of Games), I decided to try their router and I've been very satisfied. I have a lot of older IP cameras and file servers that require port forwarding. It was very easy with their firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Kaboom

customer_reviews.title: Finally WiFi in an apartment that doesn't suck
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but positive things to say about this unit. I've lived in 2 separate apartment complexes and WiFi congestion is usually just a fact of life in them. However this unit with 3 separate send/receive channels is an absolute blowtorch. 2.4 GHz is usually a no-go in apartments. I've had fancy televisions with built in apps that absolutely couldn't be used on the router from my local cable provider. With this unit, no problems. It may be a high-end router, but it's worth the coin.
customer_reviews.author: Horsedick.mpg

customer_reviews.title: Internect connection drops everyday and needs manual restart to get access again.
customer_reviews.text: I have this router for a year without problem. I really like it. But after a year problem starts! Internet connection keeps dropping everyday. You need to restart the router to get connection again. I have the latest firmware and still having the same issue. I use this mainly for my security camera which I always check everyday when Im out for work. It has no use now bec once the internet gets disconnected, there is no way for me to restart the router manually. I did try the everyday restart option on the router , but that doesnt solve the real problem. Hope some one can reach out to me and help me with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cuyugan

customer_reviews.title: Great performance except for poor range
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS RT-AC3200 is a decent unit and I'd like to say that I like it a lot more, but it does tend to drop signals pretty often and that gets annoying. I will have to purchase another expensive ASUS product, a range extender, so that this will reach everywhere in my 2,000 sq. ft. 2-story home. For the rooms close to it, it does a much better job than my old NETGEAR N600 Dual Band Wi-Fi Router (WNDR3400) did, as far as speed goes, but range is not near as good as my old unit. Still, I would recommend this unit or some of their similar units, especially if you can centrally locate it inside of your house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Howard

customer_reviews.title: Disconnected all day long; returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Disconnected all the time. WPS never worked either. I'm not an IT expert but I know enough to troubleshoot and figure out most technical issues. Plus I worked with ASUS support a few times on the issues, to no avail. Returned this and got the Netgear Nighthawk X8. Haven't had a single issue with the X8. This AC3200 is a nice router, software is good, ASUS support was good, but ultimately it just didn't work and wasn't reliable, and that's what matters at the end of the day. A great router is one you set up and never have to think about again if you don't want to, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Dwebbe

customer_reviews.title: Robust, high quality router
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for about 2 weeks now. It performs great, both in data rate and in range. My kids, who used to complain about the wi-fi quality at home, are now absolutely happy. The only aspect I had some trouble with was the automatic setup procedure - which did not get me to a working connection. I used the manual procedure, which is very straightforward. I selected the smart connection, which enables a single SSID for all three bands. This is a solid product and I would recommend it to anyone interested in high-bandwidth wireless network at home.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've ever had (10+ lifetime)
customer_reviews.text: I don't need to rehash what everyone else is saying, but definitely the best router I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and install Asuswrt-Merlin on it, you'll be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andyroo

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a recommendation from a trusted friend. Unfortunately, after two months of use, I now hate this router. It has never worked as advertised. Now wifi is spotty at best. I cant return it. They cant fix it. I'm stuck. Costumer service is terrible. Please save the trouble. Do NOT buy. I will never purchase another Asus device again. I will tell everyone I know how terrible it is as well. Thanks for nothing Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great and speeds are good....when devices connect
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Netgear Nighthawk AC1900. I completely regret this decision. The ASUS AC3200 has given me nothing but problems. Some devices will only connect using SmartConnect, but then will drop the connection, and won't be able to reconnect. Some devices will only connect when SmartConnect is off. Prior to upgrading I had no issue connecting every device. I've tried every setting and user advice that I have been able to find on tech forums. When things are connected, it works great and speeds are good, just can't get everything to connect as I could before. Sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: pewdiepie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fast but it sometimes loses its configuration or just ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fast but it sometimes loses its configuration or just stops functioning (twice in the last month or so). Excellent interface and setting options. UPDATE (Less than 1 year) This thing has been a constant pain in the buns! 11 months later and it is no longer saving Port Forwarding information making the router nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bossgrady

customer_reviews.title: Zero Customer Service!!
customer_reviews.text: Not even two years old and quit working! Tried to get in touch with Customer Service through the phone number supplied in the box and through email! NOTHING!! If you don’t have good customer service then you don’t have a company!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cox

customer_reviews.title: smart connect no so smart
customer_reviews.text: I got this router as a gift. I noticed some problems. My oldest laptop wasnt able to connect to smart connect. I had to build a dedicated 2.4 ghz band for it. In additon the Chromecast stick exhibited the same issue. I also noticed a computer I gamed with had issue with dropping connection. I built a dedicated 5ghz band and it stays connected more consistently. I wonder if anyone else experienced the same issue. Firmware was updated but no real change
customer_reviews.author: readerintx

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Got this installed the other night, taking the place of a gigabit wired router and a separate access point. It seems to be working fine. Each wirelessly connected device on my network had to be re-connected since it uses a different security scheme, but that was easy. I did find that some devices don't see the 5GHz range, so keep that in mind when choosing which of the 3 network bands you can configure. I did have to remember which MAC I have associated with Comcast, since without it they want to "activate" my account again. It makes you manually type in the MAC, can't copy and paste it.
customer_reviews.author: Gralfus

customer_reviews.title: A great buy and good for a secure network.
customer_reviews.text: The Asus branded WRT firmware is pretty neat. There are enough bells and whistles to satisy people that are tech savvy to configure a highly efficient and secure wireless network. AIProtection is very useful and informational. It allowed me to identify problem areas with devices and browsing habits. The IPS function is great too since it shines a light on all the attacks a typical home network is subjected to. Finally, this router directly contributed to near 100% speed increases for inter-network traffic.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Meece

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about moving from my Apple router, but with all the streaming and new devices in the house. Did a bit of research and ASUS kept on coming to the top. This was super easy to set up out of the box. I was up and running in 20 minutes. Great coverage across my house and beyond. The multiple bands work perfect with all the devices i have and had eliminated any slowdowns from network transfer. Sped everything up. I have had no issues with coverage being dropped. Have been exploring some of the advanced features. This thing does a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mundt

customer_reviews.title: Great ñroduct but does not last
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, my third Asus router. First one, radio went bad, the second one burnt the power switch, the third one only lasted a year. Done with Asus. I did like the way they look, the user interface is pretty simple and easy tonuse but they don't last. Time to wake uo Asus amd offer better warrantyike your us counter parts do.
customer_reviews.author: W____R

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router but coudln't get QOS to work properly
customer_reviews.text: Very nice router, my only complaint is that myself and my friends that own this model were unable to get QOS to work properly. It would just slow everything no matter what we did. This baby handles my 350mbit internet just fine and LAN speeds are 115 MB/s (920mbits). It handles multiple downloads like a chance. I couldn't get the CPU over 20% even when I tried to stress test it. Works great with Cat6 cabling. The wifi signal is strong and pretty fast. I was coming from an 802.11g to this so it was a big jump for me
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kilmer

customer_reviews.title: Probably wouldn't purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2017 almost 3 years ago. Worked great till now. Dropping our signal about every hour. It has multiple connections all I have to do is change which one I'm using and it works again. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used, like new. It came with an open box, but all the components factory sealed, so it was never actually used. I paired it with my ASUS CM-16 modem and I'm getting about 384mb/s on average, huge noticeable difference. Range extended s down the street form my house even. I like how you enable smart connect, and it'll take all three bands (2.4ghz, and both the 5ghz) channels and makes them one, and auto assigns the best one to your device. I'm a PC gamer, and I would recommend this to all of my PC friends.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Burton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router
customer_reviews.text: Love the customizations you can do via online. Only downside is apple devices struggle to connect to 2.4ghz band, often saying wrong password sometimes and accepting it others. Apparently this is an asus software bug that sill needs to be fixed. 5ghz bands work just fine though. If you only have apple phones at home like me setting up smart devices can be frustrating until they fix this bug.
customer_reviews.author: J Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, but the software is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Good hardware, but the software is lacking. Specifically, (1) Smart Connect is inconsistent, and (2) regardless of whether Smart Connect is enable or disabled, very often devices on one band could not see devices on another band (2.4 vs 5). Asus Merlin firmware has the same problems. Installing Advanced Tomato firmware seems to have fixed the problem (though no Smart Connect).
customer_reviews.author: Uuugh

customer_reviews.title: Downstairs was worse with transfer rates never exceeding 750k
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS NOW! I upgraded from the Asus RT-N16 due to massive WiFi issues. I was getting 1 to 2 MB/s transfer on my laptop when within 8 feet of the N16. Downstairs was worse with transfer rates never exceeding 750k. Upgraded to this bad boy and changed the WiFi card in my laptop to one that supports AC and the 5Ghz band now I am averaging 80MB/s downstairs! Also I suggest to replace the Asus default firmware with Merlins version of the ASUS firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Neihn

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky not impossible
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, I already knew it was going to be a good router. Just a little tricky at first, NOT impossible. If you have an adult tech savvy ( read instruction and patient) :-) person around the house Not Impossible!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Byers Sr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent strength and speed
customer_reviews.text: We have a very long house and the router is on one side. We never could get a signal to the other dude. Now we can. The kids are very happy with the speed and strength of the signal. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E Petro

customer_reviews.title: Great router from a great company...
customer_reviews.text: I have always like ASUS products and this Wireless router is no exception. The boost to our signal has tripled from the cable provider's best router. Not to mention the boost in wifi speeds. The security is top notch. You will not be disappointed in this product or really any ASUS products.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Good - but only lasted six months
customer_reviews.text: Our router only lasted 6 months. It was awesome and we loved it until it stopped working and the power cord to it stopped working. I will update the review once I see how long the new one lasts. It is an expensive router to only last six months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asuswrt Merlin
customer_reviews.text: I got this router to replace my ASUS RT-AC66 with Asuswrt Merlin firmware. When I first got the router and set it up. All seemed to be fine but then after a couple days it started disconnecting randomly. Then a couple weeks went by and Asus released a better firmware but the problems were still there just not as bad. Then a couple weeks after that Asuswrt Merlin can out with a improved firmware and have not had any issues since. Great router if you have the right firmware. Fast and handle lots of connections with ease
customer_reviews.author: Green Bay Belleau

product_meta.title: ASUS AC3200 Tri-Band Gigabit WiFi Router, AiProtection Lifetime Security by Trend Micro, Adaptive QoS, Parental Control (RT-AC3200)
product_meta.description: Ultra-fast 802.11ac Wi-Fi router with a combined tri-band data rate of 3200 Mbps for smooth up to 4K/UHD video playback, ultra-fast file-sharing for large files and low-latency online gaming. Does not support Aimesh systems
feature_bullets: Smart Connect automatically selects the fastest band for all devices individually, based on their demands and capabilities
Built-in USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 ports for up to 10-times faster data transfers to USB storage devices1, printer sharing, and 3G/4G dongle support
Protection with Trend Micro with triple-strength total network security, plus robust parental controls and privacy protection. Does not support Aimesh systems

ASUS AiCloud 2.0 lets you access, sync, share and stream your files anywhere, on any internet-connected device. Coverage- Large homes. Wi-Fi Technology-Beamforming- standard-based and universal, 256QAM high data rate, 20/40/80 MHz bandwidth
AiProtection with Trend MicroTM for complete network security .High performance antennas with AiRadar universal beamforming for unrivaled Wi-Fi
802.11ac tri-band Wi-Fi router boosts speeds up to 3200Mbps for low-latency online gaming, smooth 4K UHD video playback and extremely fast file-sharing.
ASUSWRT graphical user interface for easy, CD-free 30-second setup and hassle-free advanced network control.Dimension:11.4x 7.4 x2.28 inches (WxDxH) (Without Bezel)

specifications.Operating System: Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7, vista, 2000, ME, XP, server 2003, server 2008; Mac OS X 10.1, 10.4, 10.5, 10.6 10.7, 10.8, Mac OS X; Linux Kernel
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,587 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
